news_header: India now hosts about three-quarters of the world's tiger population, which has more than doubled from 1,706 to nearly 3,700 between 2010 and 2022 due to conservation efforts.
news_original_title: Conservation efforts double India's tiger population
news_text: Protected areas have allowed tigers to thrive, even in regions shared with millions of people. However, only a quarter of these areas are prey-rich and protected. The coexistence of tigers and humans is essential for future stability, despite challenges. The findings of the study suggest a need for more rigorous data collection to inform conservation strategies.
